forest.content:
Encountered a real-world 'magic forest' in Indonesia
Trees in the forest grow 'wild and fierce'
Being there feels like Jurassic Park
Dense foliage with incredible tree tension ğŸŒ²
Feel the vibrant life force inside

ğŸŒ³ About this 'forest'

Trees look like 'Jurassic Park', located on Java Island, Indonesia, can visit before or after Ijen volcano

canyon.title: Natural Wonder: Majestic Glaciers Create Most Fragmented Canyon
canyon.content:
FjaÃ°rÃ¡rgljÃºfur Canyon is a famous canyon in southern Iceland ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¸, attracting many tourists with its unique terrain and magnificent natural landscape.

Located near KirkjubÃ¦jarklaustur in Iceland, about 250km from Reykjavik.

Length: About 2km
Depth: Up to 100m

Formation: FjaÃ°rÃ¡rgljÃºfur was formed by glacial meltwater and river erosion during the last ice age about 2 million years ago. The FjaÃ°rÃ¡ River flows gently through the canyon bottom.

Steep cliffs on both sides with delicate rock formations, combined with green vegetation, create visually stunning natural scenery

Rivers and waterfalls in the canyon depths add mystery and beauty, especially after rain when water flow is abundant, the scene is more spectacular.

Walk along the trail above the canyon to enjoy panoramic views, best viewing point at the end of the trail overlooking the entire canyon.
Best visiting time: May to September is the best tourist season, mild summer climate suitable for hiking and outdoor activities.

canyon.title: Grand Canyon Antelope Valley | Who Says Cracks Aren't Beautiful
canyon.content:
Who would have thought that beneath small surface cracks lies such a magnificent other world. Booked a two-day tour from Las Vegas to visit the long-awaited Antelope Valley & Colorado Grand Canyon. Cracks are indeed a form of beauty.

D1 Grand Canyon - Horseshoe Bend
Got up early to head to the Grand Canyon from textbooks. Even in air-conditioned car, could feel the scorching heat outside almost causing heatstroke. Along the way in desert shops, first encountered California where everyone makes Trump memes.
Although seen countless pictures in textbooks, the real Grand Canyon still shocked me. Its massive scale far exceeds imagination, said to be the only Earth crack visible from space.
At sunset headed to Horseshoe Bend, people from around the world sitting on cliffs without railings. Some year some day, we watched the same sunset with strangers at some distant place, also a kind of romance.
D2 Antelope Valley - Zion National Park
One of the most anticipated places on this trip. Golden purple red cracks in sunlight, Colorado River-carved gelato-like textures, most shocking moment wasn't walking inside. But when you walk from canyon back to ground, hard to imagine such a thin crack contains such a bizarre world.
Zion National Park was just a photo stop, unique for its multi-layered colorful mountain terrain.

canyon.title: Grand Canyon
canyon.content: World's #1 Grand Canyon, the most famous canyon, walking inside gives an indescribable shock, continuous peaks with well-arranged cracks, really worth visiting!!

desert.title: Egypt Black Desert Crystal Mountain White Desert
desert.content:
Early morning we set off to camp in the Sahara Desert
In principle just bring one carry-on luggage
Simple change of clothes and toiletries
First stop Black Desert because it's all volcanic
Second stop Crystal Mountain with visible crystals
But can't collect them, customs will confiscate
Finally the White Desert
White Desert used to be under the sea
Can still see shells on the ground
Then went to camping base
People there helped us set up tents and barbecue
Can bring playing cards or board games
Time passed quickly in laughter

Most amazing was the starry sky and sunrise
Although environment was definitely challenging
Maybe only this way can we harvest different beauty

desert.title: ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡¦ Morocco Desert Journey | Enter North Africa's Golden Wonderland
desert.content:
First time stepping into the Sahara, truly felt the shock of 'desert'.
From Marrakech all the way south, crossing the High Atlas Mountains, greeted by endless golden ocean ğŸŒµğŸ«
Riding camels watching sunset, night around campfire gazing at stars, every second like filming a movie

desert.title: Not in Sahara Desert! In Melbourne!
desert.content: Friends thought I went to the desert, actually it's Big Drift in Wilson Prom National Park. Recommend going at evening sunset time, can see sun and moon together with desert sunset, and weather is cool. If going in summer under big sun would be painful, hiking from park entrance to desert about two kilometers, then need to climb to desert top, this area is huge, can't see the end at a glance, very worth visiting!

lake.title: God's Palette: Australia Pink Lakes, Love at First SightğŸŒ¸
lake.content:
ğŸ’— The moment I encountered pink salt lakes in Australia, I was truly amazed! As a visual person, this dreamy pink lake is simply the best gift from heaven for girlsï½

Today I want to share with you the 4 stunning pink salt lakes I visited in Australia, each one is breathtakingly beautiful!

ğŸŒ¸ Lake Hillier Most Dreamy
8-hour drive from Perth, but absolutely worth it! Lake water shows unique strawberry milkshake color, forming beautiful contrast with deep blue Indian Ocean. I chose to take a sightseeing plane for aerial view, that moment was truly shocking - perfect blend of pink, blue, green colors, like a natural watercolor painting.

ğŸ“¸ Photo Tips: Recommend booking 9-11am flights, light is best for aerial photography.

ğŸ€ Hutt Lagoon Most Variable
Pink here changes with time, from light pink to deep purple possible! I specifically chose sunset time to visit, lake surface covered with pink-purple glow, unreal beauty. Standing by the lake, gently touching crystallized salt particles, like touching a fairy tale world.

ğŸ“¸ Photo Tips: 1 hour before sunset is best shooting time, lake color most vibrant.

ğŸ’ Lake Bumbunga Best for Photos
2-hour drive from Adelaide, my most recommended spot! Salt crystal layers here perfect for creativity, I drew a big heart on salt layer with pink lake water, photos came out so beautiful!

ğŸ“¸ Photo Tips: Bring small mirror, can create seamless sky-lake connection effect.

ğŸŒ¸ Lake MacDonnell Most Photogenic
There's a super popular 'internet famous road' here, pink lake water on one side, blue-green seawater on the other. Took many creative photos here, standing in middle of road for photos definitely gets great shots!

Practical Tips:
Recommend renting car for self-drive, convenient for multiple spots
Prepare sunscreen, strong reflection by lake
Recommend bringing mirror props for more creative photos
Choose sunny day, cloudy weather affects lake color

lake.title: Utah Salt Lake City Pink Salt Lake
lake.content: Salt Lake City, Utah state capital, ğŸ“ Stansbury Viewpoint pink salt lake! So amazing! Salt Lake City's name comes from nearby Great Salt Lake, North America's largest saltwater lake, November-May when water abundant can see sky mirror! Great Salt Lake appears pink because lake water contains special halophilic algae (Dunaliella salina), this algae under specific conditions produces Î²-carotene, making lake water appear pink

lake.title: Oeschinensee Lake
lake.content:
ğŸ©µğŸ©µ Tiffany blue lake surface is incredibly beautiful, hiking around lake every section amazed me to exclaim wow... all original photos! Afternoon turned cloudy, lake surface became gray, check weather forecast before departure, must go on sunny days,

Hiking route: Cable car starting point loop about 12km, walking and stopping for photos about 4 hours, 600m elevation gain, recommend wearing hard-soled anti-slip hiking shoes. Before going down played slide, 6CHF per ride.

Returning to Interlaken passed Speiz town for quick visit, scenery also nice (last two photos).

Personally think Interlaken most worth visiting Oeschinensee Lake, beats First Mountain, although haven't been (tomorrow/next day raining, probably scenery not great), and First mainly entertainment activities.
